QuestionStem: How might damage to the temporal lobe of the brain affect a person? Which sensory receptor messages would be affected?

options.AnswerText: A. The brain might not be able to interpret messages from mechanical receptors in the ears, so the person might not be able to hear.
B. The brain might not be able to interpret messages from chemoreceptors in the nose, so the person might not be able to smell.
C. The brain might not be able to interpret messages from electromagnetic receptors in the eyes, so the person might not be able to see.
D. The brain might not be able to interpret messages from mechanical receptors in the skin, so the person might not be able to feel pressure.

CorrectFeedback: The temporal lobe is involved in hearing and smelling, so damage to this area of the brain might affect the processing of information from mechanical receptors in the ears as well as chemical receptors in the nose.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Study the diagram of the parts of the brain. Which senses are processed primarily by the temporal lobe?
IncorrectFeedback: Study the diagram of the parts of the brain. Which senses are processed primarily by the temporal lobe?
